newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - Indian market mixed in sparse trade.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - Indian market mixed in sparse trade.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) fell in line with the local market in thin trade.
"It was very quiet and essentially stock dependent," said a trader.

The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed down 0.61 points, 0.97 percent, at 61.51 points, with the premium over the local market at 14.12 percent after the Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index fell 15.83 points, or 0.51 percent to 3,110.23, off 3,134.14.

Traders said there were sellers of Indian Hotels, down 73 cents at $22.00/$23.00, Century Textiles, up $2.50 at $65.00/$80.00, TELCO down 10 cents at $11.75/$12.75 and Larsen & Toubro down 48 cents at $13.65/$14.75.
There were buyers of SAIL, up five cents at $9.25/$10.00, Mahindra, up a cent at $10.75/$11.75 and Ashok, down six cents at $10.25/$11.25.
"But to be honest there was not a great deal of business," said the trader.

The Capel Korea GDR Index ended off 0.79 points, 1.21 percent, at 64.92, a premium of 24.45 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index ended 4.29 points lower at a provisional 743.03.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended down 0.31 points, 0.35 percent, at 90.62, a premium of 0.58 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index rose 24.34 to 6,601.63.
